metadata.name: Location Type
Type de lieu
metadata.description:
US NGA Feature Designation Codes
On this codelist 'category' is used for the Feature Class.
Codes du US NGA désignant des entités géographiques. Dans cette liste, "catégorie" correspond au type d'entité.

codelist-item.description: abandoned airfield

codelist-item.name: abandoned camp
codelist-item.description: abandoned camp

codelist-item.description: abandoned canal

codelist-item.description: abandoned farm

codelist-item.name: abandoned mission
codelist-item.description: abandoned mission

codelist-item.name: abandoned oil well
codelist-item.description: abandoned oil well

codelist-item.name: abandoned police post
codelist-item.description: abandoned police post

codelist-item.name: abandoned populated place
codelist-item.description: abandoned populated place

codelist-item.name: abandoned prison
codelist-item.description: abandoned prison

codelist-item.name: abandoned railroad
codelist-item.description: abandoned railroad

codelist-item.name: abandoned railroad station
codelist-item.description: abandoned railroad station

codelist-item.name: abandoned railroad stop
codelist-item.description: abandoned railroad stop

codelist-item.name: abandoned watercourse
codelist-item.description: a former stream or distributary no longer carrying flowing water, but still evident due to lakes, wetland, topographic or vegetation patterns

codelist-item.name: abandoned well
codelist-item.description: abandoned well

codelist-item.name: administrative division
codelist-item.description: an administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

codelist-item.name: administrative facility
codelist-item.description: a government building

codelist-item.name: agricultural colony
codelist-item.description: a tract of land set aside for agricultural settlement

codelist-item.name: agricultural facility
codelist-item.description: a building and/or tract of land used for improving agriculture

codelist-item.name: agricultural reserve
codelist-item.description: a tract of land reserved for agricultural reclamation and/or development

codelist-item.name: agricultural school
codelist-item.description: a school with a curriculum focused on agriculture

codelist-item.name: airbase
codelist-item.description: an area used to store supplies, provide barracks for air force personnel, hangars and runways for aircraft, and from which operations are initiated

codelist-item.name: airfield
codelist-item.description: a place on land where aircraft land and take off; no facilities provided for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

codelist-item.name: airport
codelist-item.description: a place where aircraft regularly land and take off, with runways, navigational aids, and major facilities for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

codelist-item.name: amphitheater
codelist-item.description: an oval or circular structure with rising tiers of seats about a stage or open space

codelist-item.name: anabranch
codelist-item.description: a diverging branch flowing out of a main stream and rejoining it downstream

codelist-item.name: anchorage
codelist-item.description: an area where vessels may anchor

codelist-item.name: ancient road
codelist-item.description: the remains of a road used by ancient cultures

codelist-item.name: ancient site
codelist-item.description: a place where archeological remains, old structures, or cultural artifacts are located

codelist-item.name: ancient wall
codelist-item.description: the remains of a linear defensive stone structure

codelist-item.name: apartment building
codelist-item.description: a building containing several individual apartments

codelist-item.name: aquaculture facility
codelist-item.description: facility or area for the cultivation of aquatic animals and plants, especially fish, shellfish, and seaweed, in natural or controlled marine or freshwater environments; underwater agriculture

codelist-item.name: aqueduct
codelist-item.description: a conduit used to carry water

codelist-item.name: arch
codelist-item.description: a natural or man-made structure in the form of an arch

codelist-item.name: Arctic land
codelist-item.description: a tract of land in the Arctic

codelist-item.name: area
codelist-item.description: a tract of land without homogeneous character or boundaries

codelist-item.name: artificial island
codelist-item.description: an island created by landfill or diking and filling in a wetland, bay, or lagoon

codelist-item.name: artillery range
codelist-item.description: a tract of land used for artillery firing practice

codelist-item.name: asphalt lake
codelist-item.description: a small basin containing naturally occurring asphalt

codelist-item.name: astronomical station
codelist-item.description: a point on the earth whose position has been determined by observations of celestial bodies

codelist-item.name: asylum
codelist-item.description: a facility where the insane are cared for and protected

codelist-item.name: athletic field
codelist-item.description: a tract of land used for playing team sports, and athletic track and field events

codelist-item.name: atoll(s)
codelist-item.description: a ring-shaped coral reef which has closely spaced islands on it encircling a lagoon

codelist-item.name: atomic center
codelist-item.description: a facility where atomic research is carried out

codelist-item.name: badlands
codelist-item.description: an area characterized by a maze of very closely spaced, deep, narrow, steep-sided ravines, and sharp crests and pinnacles

codelist-item.name: baling station
codelist-item.description: a facility for baling agricultural products

codelist-item.name: banana plantation
codelist-item.description: an estate that specializes in the growing of bananas

codelist-item.name: bank
codelist-item.description: an establishment for the custody, loan, exchange or issue of money, for the extension of credit, and for facilitating the transmission of funds

codelist-item.name: bank(s)
codelist-item.description: an elevation, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for most surface navigation

codelist-item.name: bar
codelist-item.description: a shallow ridge or mound of coarse unconsolidated material in a stream channel, at the mouth of a stream, estuary, or lagoon and in the wave-break zone along coasts

codelist-item.name: barracks
codelist-item.description: a building for lodging military personnel

codelist-item.name: battlefield
codelist-item.description: a site of a land battle of historical importance

codelist-item.name: bay
codelist-item.description: a coastal indentation between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

codelist-item.name: bays
codelist-item.description: coastal indentations between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

codelist-item.name: beach
codelist-item.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

codelist-item.name: beach ridge
codelist-item.description: a ridge of sand just inland and parallel to the beach, usually in series

codelist-item.name: beaches
codelist-item.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

codelist-item.name: beacon
codelist-item.description: a fixed artificial navigation mark

codelist-item.name: bench
codelist-item.description: a long, narrow bedrock platform bounded by steeper slopes above and below, usually overlooking a waterbody

codelist-item.name: bight(s)
codelist-item.description: an open body of water forming a slight recession in a coastline

codelist-item.name: blowhole(s)
codelist-item.description: a hole in coastal rock through which sea water is forced by a rising tide or waves and spurted through an outlet into the air

codelist-item.name: blowout(s)
codelist-item.description: a small depression in sandy terrain, caused by wind erosion

codelist-item.name: boatyard
codelist-item.description: a waterside facility for servicing, repairing, and building small vessels

codelist-item.name: bog(s)
codelist-item.description: a wetland characterized by peat forming sphagnum moss, sedge, and other acid-water plants

codelist-item.name: border post
codelist-item.description: a post or station at an international boundary for the regulation of movement of people and goods

codelist-item.name: boulder field
codelist-item.description: a high altitude or high latitude bare, flat area covered with large angular rocks

codelist-item.name: boundary marker
codelist-item.description: a fixture marking a point along a boundary

codelist-item.name: breakwater
codelist-item.description: a structure erected to break the force of waves at the entrance to a harbor or port

codelist-item.name: brewery
codelist-item.description: one or more buildings where beer is brewed

codelist-item.name: bridge
codelist-item.description: a structure erected across an obstacle such as a stream, road, etc., in order to carry roads, railroads, and pedestrians across

codelist-item.name: buffer zone
codelist-item.description: a zone recognized as a buffer between two nations in which military presence is minimal or absent

codelist-item.name: building(s)
codelist-item.description: a structure built for permanent use, as a house, factory, etc.

codelist-item.name: burial cave(s)
codelist-item.description: a cave used for human burials

codelist-item.name: bush(es)
codelist-item.description: a small clump of conspicuous bushes in an otherwise bare area

codelist-item.name: business center
codelist-item.description: a place where a number of businesses are located

codelist-item.name: butte(s)
codelist-item.description: a small, isolated, usually flat-topped hill with steep sides

codelist-item.name: cairn
codelist-item.description: a heap of stones erected as a landmark or for other purposes

codelist-item.name: caldera
codelist-item.description: a depression measuring kilometers across formed by the collapse of a volcanic mountain

codelist-item.name: camp(s)
codelist-item.description: a site occupied by tents, huts, or other shelters for temporary use

codelist-item.name: canal
codelist-item.description: an artificial watercourse

codelist-item.name: canal bend
codelist-item.description: a conspicuously curved or bent section of a canal

codelist-item.name: canal tunnel
codelist-item.description: a tunnel through which a canal passes

codelist-item.name: canalized stream
codelist-item.description: a stream that has been substantially ditched, diked, or straightened

codelist-item.name: cannery
codelist-item.description: a building where food items are canned

codelist-item.name: canyon
codelist-item.description: a deep, narrow valley with steep sides cutting into a plateau or mountainous area

codelist-item.name: cape
codelist-item.description: a land area, more prominent than a point, projecting into the sea and marking a notable change in coastal direction

codelist-item.name: capital of a political entity
codelist-item.description: capital of a political entity

codelist-item.name: caravan route
codelist-item.description: the route taken by caravans

codelist-item.name: casino
codelist-item.description: a building used for entertainment, especially gambling

codelist-item.name: castle
codelist-item.description: a large fortified building or set of buildings

codelist-item.name: cattle dipping tank
codelist-item.description: a small artificial pond used for immersing cattle in chemically treated water for disease control

codelist-item.name: causeway
codelist-item.description: a raised roadway across wet ground or shallow water

codelist-item.name: cave(s)
codelist-item.description: an underground passageway or chamber, or cavity on the side of a cliff

codelist-item.name: cemetery
codelist-item.description: a burial place or ground

codelist-item.name: channel
codelist-item.description: the deepest part of a stream, bay, lagoon, or strait, through which the main current flows

codelist-item.name: chrome mine(s)
codelist-item.description: a mine where chrome ore is extracted

codelist-item.name: church
codelist-item.description: a building for public Christian worship

codelist-item.name: cirque
codelist-item.description: a bowl-like hollow partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

codelist-item.name: cirques
codelist-item.description: bowl-like hollows partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

codelist-item.name: clearing
codelist-item.description: an area in a forest with trees removed

codelist-item.name: cleft(s)
codelist-item.description: a deep narrow slot, notch, or groove in a coastal cliff

codelist-item.name: cliff(s)
codelist-item.description: a high, steep to perpendicular slope overlooking a waterbody or lower area

codelist-item.name: clinic
codelist-item.description: a medical facility associated with a hospital for outpatients

codelist-item.name: coal mine(s)
codelist-item.description: a mine where coal is extracted

codelist-item.name: coalfield
codelist-item.description: a region in which coal deposits of possible economic value occur

codelist-item.name: coast
codelist-item.description: a zone of variable width straddling the shoreline

codelist-item.name: coast guard station
codelist-item.description: a facility from which the coast is guarded by armed vessels

codelist-item.name: coconut grove
codelist-item.description: a planting of coconut trees

codelist-item.name: college
codelist-item.description: the grounds and buildings of an institution of higher learning

codelist-item.name: common
codelist-item.description: a park or pasture for community use

codelist-item.name: communication center
codelist-item.description: a facility, including buildings, antennae, towers and electronic equipment for receiving and transmitting information

codelist-item.name: community center
codelist-item.description: a facility for community recreation and other activities

codelist-item.name: concession area
codelist-item.description: a lease of land by a government for economic development, e.g., mining, forestry

codelist-item.name: cone(s)
codelist-item.description: a conical landform composed of mud or volcanic material

codelist-item.name: confluence
codelist-item.description: a place where two or more streams or intermittent streams flow together

codelist-item.name: continental rise
codelist-item.description: a gentle slope rising from oceanic depths towards the foot of a continental slope

codelist-item.name: convent
codelist-item.description: a building where a community of nuns lives in seclusion

codelist-item.name: copper mine(s)
codelist-item.description: a mine where copper ore is extracted

codelist-item.name: copper works
codelist-item.description: a facility for processing copper ore

codelist-item.name: coral reef(s)
codelist-item.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of coral

codelist-item.name: corral(s)
codelist-item.description: a pen or enclosure for confining or capturing animals

codelist-item.name: corridor
codelist-item.description: a strip or area of land having significance as an access way

codelist-item.name: cotton plantation
codelist-item.description: an estate specializing in the cultivation of cotton

codelist-item.name: country house
codelist-item.description: a large house, mansion, or chateau, on a large estate

codelist-item.name: courthouse
codelist-item.description: a building in which courts of law are held

codelist-item.name: cove(s)
codelist-item.description: a small coastal indentation, smaller than a bay

codelist-item.name: crater lake
codelist-item.description: a lake in a crater or caldera

codelist-item.name: crater lakes
codelist-item.description: lakes in a crater or caldera

codelist-item.name: crater(s)
codelist-item.description: a generally circular saucer or bowl-shaped depression caused by volcanic or meteorite explosive action

codelist-item.name: cuesta(s)
codelist-item.description: an asymmetric ridge formed on tilted strata

codelist-item.name: cultivated area
codelist-item.description: an area under cultivation

codelist-item.name: current
codelist-item.description: a horizontal flow of water in a given direction with uniform velocity

codelist-item.name: customs house
codelist-item.description: a building in a port where customs and duties are paid, and where vessels are entered and cleared

codelist-item.name: customs post
codelist-item.description: a building at an international boundary where customs and duties are paid on goods

codelist-item.name: cutoff
codelist-item.description: a channel formed as a result of a stream cutting through a meander neck

codelist-item.name: dairy
codelist-item.description: a facility for the processing, sale and distribution of milk or milk products

codelist-item.name: dam
codelist-item.description: a barrier constructed across a stream to impound water

codelist-item.name: deep
codelist-item.description: a localized deep area within the confines of a larger feature, such as a trough, basin or trench

codelist-item.name: delta

codelist-item.name: dependent political entity
codelist-item.description: dependent political entity

codelist-item.name: depression(s)
codelist-item.description: a low area surrounded by higher land and usually characterized by interior drainage

codelist-item.name: desert
codelist-item.description: a large area with little or no vegetation due to extreme environmental conditions

codelist-item.name: destroyed populated place
codelist-item.description: a village, town or city destroyed by a natural disaster, or by war

codelist-item.name: diatomite mine(s)
codelist-item.description: a place where diatomaceous earth is extracted

codelist-item.name: dike
codelist-item.description: an earth or stone embankment usually constructed for flood or stream control

codelist-item.name: diplomatic facility
codelist-item.description: office, residence, or facility of a foreign government, which may include an embassy, consulate, chancery, office of charge d’affaires, or other diplomatic, economic, military, or cultural mission

codelist-item.name: dispensary
codelist-item.description: a building where medical or dental aid is dispensed

codelist-item.name: distributary(-ies)
codelist-item.description: a branch which flows away from the main stream, as in a delta or irrigation canal

codelist-item.name: ditch
codelist-item.description: a small artificial watercourse dug for draining or irrigating the land

codelist-item.name: ditch mouth(s)

codelist-item.name: divide

codelist-item.name: dock(s)

codelist-item.name: docking basin
codelist-item.description: a part of a harbor where ships dock

codelist-item.name: dockyard
codelist-item.description: a facility for servicing, building, or repairing ships

codelist-item.name: drainage basin
codelist-item.description: an area drained by a stream

codelist-item.name: drainage canal
codelist-item.description: an artificial waterway carrying water away from a wetland or from drainage ditches

codelist-item.name: drainage ditch
codelist-item.description: a ditch which serves to drain the land

codelist-item.name: dry dock
codelist-item.description: a dock providing support for a vessel, and means for removing the water so that the bottom of the vessel can be exposed

codelist-item.name: dry stream bed
codelist-item.description: a channel formerly containing the water of a stream

codelist-item.name: dune(s)
codelist-item.description: a wave form, ridge or star shape feature composed of sand

codelist-item.name: economic region
codelist-item.description: a region of a country established for economic development or for statistical purposes

codelist-item.name: escarpment
codelist-item.description: a long line of cliffs or steep slopes separating level surfaces above and below

codelist-item.name: estate(s)
codelist-item.description: a large commercialized agricultural landholding with associated buildings and other facilities

codelist-item.name: estuary
codelist-item.description: a funnel-shaped stream mouth or embayment where fresh water mixes with sea water under tidal influences

codelist-item.name: experiment station
codelist-item.description: a facility for carrying out experiments

codelist-item.name: facility
codelist-item.description: a building or buildings housing a center, institute, foundation, hospital, prison, mission, courthouse, etc.

codelist-item.name: facility center
codelist-item.description: a place where more than one facility is situated

codelist-item.name: factory
codelist-item.description: one or more buildings where goods are manufactured, processed or fabricated

codelist-item.name: fan(s)

codelist-item.name: farm
codelist-item.description: a tract of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

codelist-item.name: farm village
codelist-item.description: a populated place where the population is largely engaged in agricultural activities

codelist-item.name: farms
codelist-item.description: tracts of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

codelist-item.name: farmstead
codelist-item.description: the buildings and adjacent service areas of a farm

codelist-item.name: ferry
codelist-item.description: a boat or other floating conveyance and terminal facilities regularly used to transport people and vehicles across a waterbody

codelist-item.name: ferry terminal
codelist-item.description: a place where ferries pick-up and discharge passengers, vehicles and or cargo

codelist-item.name: field(s)
codelist-item.description: an open as opposed to wooded area

codelist-item.name: fire station
codelist-item.description: building housing firefighters and/or fire fighting equipment

codelist-item.name: first-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a primary administrative division of a country, such as a state in the United States

codelist-item.name: fishing area
codelist-item.description: a fishing ground, bank or area where fishermen go to catch fish

codelist-item.name: fishponds
codelist-item.description: ponds or enclosures in which fish are kept or raised

codelist-item.name: fissure
codelist-item.description: a crack associated with volcanism

codelist-item.name: fjord
codelist-item.description: a long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arm of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

codelist-item.name: fjords
codelist-item.description: long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arms of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

codelist-item.name: ford
codelist-item.description: a shallow part of a stream which can be crossed on foot or by land vehicle

codelist-item.name: forest reserve
codelist-item.description: a forested area set aside for preservation or controlled use

codelist-item.name: forest station
codelist-item.description: a collection of buildings and facilities for carrying out forest management

codelist-item.name: forest(s)
codelist-item.description: an area dominated by tree vegetation

codelist-item.name: former inlet
codelist-item.description: an inlet which has been filled in, or blocked by deposits

codelist-item.name: former sugar mill
codelist-item.description: a sugar mill no longer used as a sugar mill

codelist-item.name: fort
codelist-item.description: a defensive structure or earthworks

codelist-item.name: fossilized forest
codelist-item.description: a forest fossilized by geologic processes and now exposed at the earth's surface

codelist-item.name: foundry
codelist-item.description: a building or works where metal casting is carried out

codelist-item.name: fourth-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a subdivision of a third-order administrative division

codelist-item.name: free trade zone
codelist-item.description: an area, usually a section of a port, where goods may be received and shipped free of customs duty and of most customs regulations

codelist-item.name: freely associated state
codelist-item.description: freely associated state

codelist-item.name: fuel depot
codelist-item.description: an area where fuel is stored

codelist-item.name: gap
codelist-item.description: a low place in a ridge, not used for transportation

codelist-item.name: garden(s)
codelist-item.description: an enclosure for displaying selected plant or animal life

codelist-item.name: gas-oil separator plant
codelist-item.description: a facility for separating gas from oil

codelist-item.name: gasfield
codelist-item.description: an area containing a subterranean store of natural gas of economic value

codelist-item.name: gate
codelist-item.description: a controlled access entrance or exit

codelist-item.name: geyser
codelist-item.description: a type of hot spring with intermittent eruptions of jets of hot water and steam

codelist-item.name: ghāt
codelist-item.description: a set of steps leading to a river, which are of religious significance, and at their base is usually a platform for bathing

codelist-item.name: glacier(s)
codelist-item.description: a mass of ice, usually at high latitudes or high elevations, with sufficient thickness to flow away from the source area in lobes, tongues, or masses

codelist-item.name: gold mine(s)
codelist-item.description: a mine where gold ore, or alluvial gold is extracted

codelist-item.name: golf course
codelist-item.description: a recreation field where golf is played

codelist-item.name: gorge(s)
codelist-item.description: a short, narrow, steep-sided section of a stream valley

codelist-item.name: grassland
codelist-item.description: an area dominated by grass vegetation

codelist-item.name: grave
codelist-item.description: a burial site

codelist-item.name: gravel area
codelist-item.description: an area covered with gravel

codelist-item.name: grazing area
codelist-item.description: an area of grasses and shrubs used for grazing

codelist-item.name: guest house
codelist-item.description: a house used to provide lodging for paying guests

codelist-item.name: gulf
codelist-item.description: a large recess in the coastline, larger than a bay

codelist-item.name: halting place
codelist-item.description: a place where caravans stop for rest

codelist-item.name: hammock(s)
codelist-item.description: a patch of ground, distinct from and slightly above the surrounding plain or wetland. Often occurs in groups

codelist-item.name: hangar
codelist-item.description: a covered and usually enclosed area for housing and repairing aircraft

codelist-item.name: hanging valley
codelist-item.description: a valley the floor of which is notably higher than the valley or shore to which it leads; most common in areas that have been glaciated

codelist-item.name: harbor(s)
codelist-item.description: a haven or space of deep water so sheltered by the adjacent land as to afford a safe anchorage for ships

codelist-item.name: headland
codelist-item.description: a high projection of land extending into a large body of water beyond the line of the coast

codelist-item.name: headwaters
codelist-item.description: the source and upper part of a stream, including the upper drainage basin

codelist-item.name: heath
codelist-item.description: an upland moor or sandy area dominated by low shrubby vegetation including heather

codelist-item.name: heliport
codelist-item.description: a place where helicopters land and take off

codelist-item.name: hermitage
codelist-item.description: a secluded residence, usually for religious sects

codelist-item.name: hill
codelist-item.description: a rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

codelist-item.name: hills
codelist-item.description: rounded elevations of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

codelist-item.name: historical administrative division
codelist-item.description: a former administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

codelist-item.name: historical first-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a former first-order administrative division

codelist-item.name: historical fourth-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a former fourth-order administrative division

codelist-item.name: historical political entity
codelist-item.description: a former political entity

codelist-item.name: historical populated place
codelist-item.description: a populated place that no longer exists

codelist-item.name: historical railroad
codelist-item.description: a former permanent twin steel-rail track on which freight and passenger cars move long distances

codelist-item.name: historical railroad station
codelist-item.description: a former facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight

codelist-item.name: historical region
codelist-item.description: a former area distinguished by one or more observable physical or cultural characteristics

codelist-item.name: historical second-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a former second-order administrative division

codelist-item.name: historical site
codelist-item.description: a place of historical importance

codelist-item.name: historical third-order administrative division
codelist-item.description: a former third-order administrative division

codelist-item.name: historical undersea feature
codelist-item.description: an undersea feature whose existence has been subsequently disproved

codelist-item.name: homestead
codelist-item.description: a residence, owner's or manager's, on a sheep or cattle station, woolshed, outcamp, or Aboriginal outstation, specific to Australia and New Zealand

codelist-item.name: hospital
codelist-item.description: a building in which sick or injured, especially those confined to bed, are medically treated

codelist-item.name: hot spring(s)
codelist-item.description: a place where hot ground water flows naturally out of the ground

codelist-item.name: hotel
codelist-item.description: a building providing lodging and/or meals for the public

codelist-item.name: house(s)
